intro: Tirucalia plagiantha, commonly known as the Indian flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant has simple, opposite, ovate leaves that turn yellow before falling in autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
